text:
I well know HubSpot CMS but not at all HubSpot API.
Is there a tutorial to create an simple API

My goal is simple : *CHANGE A SLUG TOPIC* using CMS Blog Topics API

have you checked this <@U3TR96G84>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/overview>
Hello <@UCH1L597V>. Yes I've already checked
hii <@U3TR96G84> so here is the endpoint for the same <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/put_blog_posts_blog_post_id>
the preferred way to use the oAuth2, but if you want to use it once you can try with hapikey too
are you going to use this via php or any other language <@U3TR96G84>?
I don't know I know php so can use it
and with hapikey how can I do it ?
I have created my URL but I don't know how to implement it and send data
you want to change the slug or topic?
the api is for changing the topic
HubSpot told me that I can change the slug topic using the API
yes for slug change we have this one <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/put_blog_posts_blog_post_id>
we can easily do that, if we have blog post id.

this method is very simple, all you have to prepare a array of blog post ids, and loop the array to send the data in the json, as shared in the example to the url
`<https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/blog-posts/348109414?hapikey=your_api_key_here>`
You can DM me and i can provide you the code snippet, with your requirement <@U3TR96G84>
Thanks a lot it works

You could use something like Postman as well to make the api request.

Then, you can use the URL you created for the api request, and the body (payload) would look like:
```
{
    "slug":"cool-slug"
}
```

(to preface, i may be asking this question incorrectly) I want to grab a query parameter from a webhook trigger I’m posting in a workflow. So when the workflow runs, I have a API endpoint url (from Vidyard in this case) in the field thats submitting a form. in browser i can see the data its returning, but once that webhook triggers, how do I retrieve the parameter I want and add  it as a contact property?

Hey <@U7AU6414J>, I'm a bit unclear as to your specific goal.
It sounds like a workflow is using the webhook action to POST to a VidYard URL...Are you trying to parse data from the body of the JSON posted to VidYard? Or is there a response from VidYard that you're trying to parse? Something else?

Hey <@UE24LMGSZ>, Apologies, I’m trying to parse data from the JSON body posted to Vidyard. I’d grab one of those data fields returned and apply it to a custom contact property I’ve created in HubSpot
Is the webhook being sent via a contact workflow?
What are you trying to grab from the JSON?

The end goal I’m trying to achieve is sending people a email  with a Vidyard personalized video thumbnail in it (the thumbnail has their first name in it). The URL for that image is formatted like this `<https://play.vidyard.com/myvideo.jpg?custom_id={{CUSTOMID}}&play_button=1>`, but i need that custom ID found in the JSON POST to be where that `{{customid}}` is.

I was trying to see if using a HubSpot workflow I could use the endpoint url I have from Vidyard and place it into a webhook, then associate one of the parameters in that JSON body to a contact property in HubSpot

This is the Vidyard documentation on their API that im working off of: <https://knowledge.vidyard.com/hc/en-us/articles/360009879594-Personalized-Video-API>

So the thumbnail in the email would be linked to `<https://play.vidyard.com/myvideo.jpg?custom_id={{CUSTOMID}}&play_button=1>` and you need `CUSTOMID` to be accessible from the contact record, so you can dynamically render that VidYard link, using a contact personalization token.
If the JSON body of a HubSpot webhook contains the custom ID, how did the ID originally get into HubSpot?

I can’t figure out how to access the JSON body of the webhook, so the ID isnt in HubSpot right now. All i did was make a new contact field for that value to go into.

The URL I’m entering into that webhook url field in HubSpot is something like this <https://blender.vidyard.com/forms/QBPXhu7sVc6oJRSfXUqKyq>. So I need to submit certain data fields to that form, then parse the response to get the parameter (named `UUDI`), which will go where the `{{customID}}` is

I think I understand. It sounds like the _response_ from VidYard is ultimately what you need to parse in order to retrieve the `UUDI`, which you would then pass back into the contact record via the `customID` contact property.
With HubSpot webhooks in workflows, a JSON body of data for the object in the workflow (i.e. contact, deal, ticket, etc.) is sent to the specified URL. The response data for that webhook (i.e. the data from VidYard in this case) is not retrievable inside HubSpot. If I'm understanding you correctly, the way I see this working would involve a middle-tier application:
1. HubSpot webhook sent to middle app.
2. Relevant data is parsed by middle app, which then sends a webhook to the VidYard app.
3. Middle app parses response from VidYard app to get the `UUDI`, then makes API call to update contact in HubSpot with the `customID` value.
4. HubSpot automation takes care of the rest to send contact the email with a dynamic VidYard URL.
Does that sound like what you're looking for?
